page.title: 19WATER IN OUR 12 sq. km.
page.content: The water table in Charing is very close to the soil surface. There are two springs in our grid square. The streams that come from them feed the Great Stour river. There are ten ponds in our grid square. They are full of little pond creatures such as pond skaters, water boatmen and whirligig beetles. We found a common horse leech in one of the ponds. Charing is also the place where this area's water supply comes from. The water board buildings are found on the Pluckley Road. There are bore-holes here. The ground is very sandy so as the water comes up from the ground it is filtered naturally. It is piped into the the buildings where Chlorine is added. The water here already has Fluorine in it, so none is added.
